newsitem.title: ESTONIA: STATE SOLD 30 PERCENT STAKE IN HOTEL OLUMPIA.
newsitem.headline: STATE SOLD 30 PERCENT STAKE IN HOTEL OLUMPIA.

text.p: Hotel Olumpia shareholders said on Friday they used their preemptive right in the privatisation process of the hotel and bought 30 percent of its shares from state.
The price was 66 million kroons, the hotel added in a statement.
Hotel Olumpia's shareholders are the Baltic Republic Fund with 40 percent, Mercury Asset Management with 19.66 percent, Inn Grupp with 12.48 percent and Hansa Investments with 2.8 percent.
The state still holds 25.06 percent of its shares, which will be sold for vouchers in a public offer between June 30 to July 18.
Olumpia, one of the largest hotels in Estonia which is located in the centre of Tallinn, had a net profit of 20 million kroons in 1996 and its turnover was 179 million kroons.
